name: lcdlmod
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, wff w0

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, clvec))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c0, clmod))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ LVec)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LVec → c0 ∈ LMod)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, clvec))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c0, clmod))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (w0 → c0 ∈ LVec)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LVec → c0 ∈ LMod)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, clvec))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clh, c2))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cfv(clcd, c2), c3))
-| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c2, chlt), wcel(c3, c1)))
body.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ LVec)
⊣ c1 =(LHyp ` c2)
⊣ c0 =((LCDual ` c2)` c3)
⊣ (w0 →(c2 ∈ HL ∧ c3 ∈ c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wi(wcel(c0, clvec), wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clh, c2))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cfv(clcd, c2), c3))
-| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c2, chlt), wcel(c3, c1)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ (c0 ∈ LVec → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ c1 =(LHyp ` c2)
⊣ c0 =((LCDual ` c2)` c3)
⊣ (w0 →(c2 ∈ HL ∧ c3 ∈ c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(c0, clmod))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(clh, c2))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(cfv(clcd, c2), c3))
-| wi(w0, wa(wcel(c2, chlt), wcel(c3, c1)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (w0 → c0 ∈ LMod)
⊣ c1 =(LHyp ` c2)
⊣ c0 =((LCDual ` c2)` c3)
⊣ (w0 →(c2 ∈ HL ∧ c3 ∈ c1))

comment: The dual vector space of functionals with closed kernels is a left module. (Contributed by NM, 13-Mar-2015.)
